Title: Integration Specialist
Job_Description:
ePayPolicy is the leader in e-payments for the P&C insurance industry. We’ve built a payments platform to enable all our market segments to easily track, report, and send /receive payments to anyone at any time. Our clients include independent agents, premium finance companies, wholesalers, and carriers. By way of our cool inventions, we empower our clients to speed up receivables and bind business faster throughout the insurance purchasing process. By integrating with over twelve different industry management systems, our clients immediately notice the ease-of-use purchasing experience and boosted productivity. Trusted by over 5,500 clients nationwide, ePayPolicy makes insurance payments super easy.
We’re based in Austin, TX and have clients in the US and Canada. Founded in 2014, we have the support and backing of Serent Capital, one of the top private equity firms in the US that invests in high-growth software and services firms and manages over $2B in committed capital.
We’re looking for an who is obsessed with delivering world-class service to join our vibrant company that’s growing fast. This role will be a key-player on our support staff and tasked with responding to customer inquiries lighting fast while being available at a moment’s notice when customers call for help.

Title: Integration Specialist
Job_Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
The Director of Technology will streamline the deployment of critical systems that will transform and automate 10X Health’s processes. The role will serve as the lead architect for our Technology team. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years’ experience in designing and implementing new systems, and work alongside the Operations team to ensure a smooth transition and anticipate any potential roadblocks. The Director of Technology will have the opportunity to recruit and develop an engineering team. This position is challenging due to the highly-regulated nature of healthcare, and more specifically high-volume, e-commerce focused nature of a Grant Cardone business. Selling healthcare services to groups of tens-of-thousands of physical, in-person customers or virtually to millions of Grant’s followers poses really unique challenges to a healthcare technology health stack.

Title: Integration Specialist
Job_Description:
KEY is leading a third wave in the travel industry by developing technology designed to revolutionize the delivery of local, curated experiences around the world. With KEY, concierge service with local knowledge is readily available at your fingertips wherever you stay, making travel effortless. With our proprietary recommendation engine, advanced technology platform and with our growing global concierge network, we help traveler’s make memories, not plans.
Your Role:
In your role, you will be responsible for developing business features and technical capabilities within KEY's Salesforce Service Cloud and Marketing Cloud instances and related data, services, and applications. You are highly familiar with our core data models and APIs in Salesforce and internal data systems and how Leads, Opportunities, Accounts, and Contacts map to key business processes in our Concierge Operation and Business Development groups. You will partner with Sales and Operations Leadership to identify, prioritize and execute the strategic roadmap of systems enhancements to drive scalability and operation efficiency in the business.

As a Software / Web Developer, you will build systems for data intake and develop integrations with internal and external (partner-facing) software systems. This is a unique opportunity to utilize your IT skills to have a meaningful impact in the clean energy space that will help solve climate change issues, while working for a great company.
Resource Innovations, with recently acquired Nexant, is a substantially woman-owned and woman-led energy consulting firm dedicated to creating equal access to clean resources through diverse partnerships. The company’s deep roots and broad expertise in resource efficiency, policy development, coalition & partnership building, and market-based technology support enable the delivery of highly successful energy programs. Nexant brings over 20 years of expertise in demand-side management, grid management and renewables as well as a comprehensive suite of software designed to support these initiatives.

Title: Integration Specialist
Job_Description:

As a Software Developer I, you will learn from the ground up and grow with the department. The first several months of this role will be spent shadowing the senior developers and taking on some of the more basic tasks. As your experience and comfort level grows, you will gradually take on more responsibilities and get more hands on within each project. We don’t require an extensive background, but some skills that will lead to your success are: the desire and ability to learn, not being afraid to ask questions, strong attention to detail, excellent ability to troubleshoot and problem solving. If this sounds like you, and you are excited to start your career in Software Development, come grow your career with Paulo!

MTS offers excellent benefits including employer paid medical coverage, generous PTO and Federal holidays, and a substantial 401(k) match program.
Position Overview:
We are looking for a Salesforce Developer to work closely with project managers and other developers to ensure the timely and effective delivery of Salesforce requirements in a variety of industry contexts. The ideal candidate must have Docgen experience. The Salesforce Developer is responsible for managing all aspects of Salesforce.com (SFDC) development including software solutioning, design, configuration, customization and implementation of applications and 3rd party integrations. Title: Integration Specialist
Job_Description:
Rockwater Associates is a growing tech-powered professional services company specializing in providing integrated services in the areas of Tax, Accounting, Human Resources, and Technology services based in Bozeman, MT. We are an agile, high performing team with deep cross-domain industry experience that share a passion for delivering integrated solutions that empower business owners to scale and grow their business. Rockwater’s mission is to combine the power of great people with great technology to achieve amazing results for our clients.
The Senior Software Developer is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining existing and new .NET applications and Integrations. This role will work closely with a small team of developers to deliver both web apps and salesforce tooling for our internal services teams. This role serves as a technical expert by creating high-level architectural specifications and addressing problems of systems integration and compatibility. The Senior Software Developer is expected to provide mentorship with regards to design patterns, architecture, process, and communication among all developers on the team. The successful candidate is an experienced, high integrity team player with exceptional communication skills and solid expertise in both the professional services and technology industry.

Title: Integration Specialist
Job_Description:
The Challenge:
When a user tries a new system, they expect it to be intuitive and run smoothly. Functionality, reliability, and user experience are key to successful information systems–and that means rigorous testing. That’s why we need you, an aspiring quality assurance specialist who’s eager to help thoroughly test software and ensure that our team releases the best system possible.
As a Salesforce quality assurance specialist, you’ll work with analysts, testers, developers, and engineers on a team that evaluates developed systems to support the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). You’ll help develop and implement a test plan based on requirements, functional specifications, and design specifications. Using requirements analysis and software quality assurance, you’ll generate problem resolutions and track quality assurance standards to see how the system performs, then document the results and communicate system flaws to the development team so they can start improving the tool. You’ll build your experience in various types of testing, including manual, performance, accessibility, usability, user acceptance testing, and testing process improvement. This is an opportunity to broaden your skills in documenting and solving system deficiencies as well as leading and mentoring others and estimating testing efforts. Ready to make an impact by transforming and modernizing healthcare systems for our military Veterans? Work with us as we build systems to change Veterans Affairs for the better. This position is open to remote delivery anywhere within the U.S., to include the District of Columbia.
ID17-C

Title: Integration Specialist
Job_Description:
Responsibilities:
Peraton is seeking experienced Salesforce Developers to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in Herndon, VA. The qualified applicant will become part of Peraton's Department of State (DOS) Consular Systems Modernization (CSM) Program, for the Bureau of Consular Affairs (CA). This initiative will modernize over 90 legacy systems over the period of 10 years and consolidate the operational environment under a common technology framework in order to better support the services provided to CA’s customers. The journey to the cloud is a key consideration for modernization of the Consular Affair’s applications. We will initially develop selected business and technical capabilities on Salesforce CRM platform and evaluate its feasibility. This will include evaluating effectiveness of the public facing online applications built on Salesforce platform, support unique digital workflows for internal consular staff, and data integrations using API-led connectivity to legacy systems.
Use your technical proficiency with the Salesforce platform to design and develop business functionalities using inbuilt CRM/CX technologies and functionalities
Qualifications:

Title: Salesforce Developer
Job_Description:
About the team
Zillow’s Salesforce team supports our growing business lines by working closely with operations, sales, and other product teams to develop creative and sustainable solutions. We are a group of Salesforce experts that understands the pros and cons of the platform and are eager to use the right tool when tackling a problem. We have the ability to think out of the box and challenge the status quo not by building on what we already have, but coming up with new ideas that spark innovation and creativity. We operate in scrum teams, strive for collaboration, and keep our users in mind while tackling enterprise challenges.
We believe in autonomy – Our Core Values include “Own it” and “Move Fast, Think Big.”
About the role
This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.

GENERAL SUMMARY
Want a career where your work matters? Where your skills make a real impact on an important problem? Where you change people's lives for the better?

Revolutionizing the funeral industry means blazing new trails, creating new ideas, developing strong relationships, preserving legacies, and compassionately caring for Families. With over 200 locations across the country, Foundation Partners Group is continuing to expand our reach, but we only do this with exceptional team members ready to embrace the future of the funeral industry.
Our Team Members are vital to the health of our funeral homes, and we value the insight, ideas, and passion they bring every day to compassionately care for our Families. FPG is transforming the funeral industry one life, one family, and one community at a time. Join us as we revolutionize the funeral industry across the nation.
We currently have an opening for a Salesforce Developer at our Home Office in Orlando, FL. This position is a Hybrid work schedule. As a Salesforce Developer at Foundation Partners, you'll have the opportunity to shape our product and technology and impact our service and customers. The Salesforce Senior Developer will design, develop, and maintain enterprise-class applications that will continue to evolve and expand throughout the business. This role will develop and maintain Salesforce applications, triage and fix technical issues, implement new functionality and eliminate technical constraints. The engineer will collaborate with the IT team to build new products and drive new business in a fast-paced, agile fashion.

Title: Salesforce Developer
Job_Description:
By joining the American Red Cross you will touch millions of lives every year and experience the greatness of the human spirit at its best. Are you ready to be part of the world's largest humanitarian network?

**** As a condition of employment with American Red Cross, you are required to provide proof that you are fully vaccinated for COVID 19 or qualify for an exemption, except in states where it is prohibited by law. Accordingly, employment is conditioned on providing proof of vaccination or having an approved exemption prior to starting employment ****

Join us-Where your Career is a Force for Good!

Job Description:

Why Choose Us?
As one of the nation's premier humanitarian organizations, the American Red Cross is dedicated to helping people in need throughout the United States and, in association with other Red Cross networks, throughout the world. We depend on the many generous contributions of time, blood, and money from the American public to support our lifesaving services and programs.

By joining the American Red Cross, you will enjoy a collaborative work culture committed to the diversity of our people, programs, and services. You will touch millions of lives every year and experience the greatness of the human spirit at its best.






The Salesforce Senior Developer will be working closely with other developers to ensure all code is consistent with architectural standards and design for the Humanitarian Services Group. This position is part of a collaborative team, responsible for understanding business requirements, LOE estimation, custom development and maintenance of code, code review, updating of technical documentation, and writing unit test scenarios.

The Salesforce Senior Developer has the skills and experience in advanced programmatic capabilities (Apex, LWC and Visualforce) of the Salesforce Platform and data modeling to develop complex business logic and interfaces. You will be responsible for providing technical guidance, mentoring, and leading the team towards successful delivery of both enhancement and run & maintain projects.



Scope: Individual contributor that works under limited supervision. Apply subject matter knowledge. Capacity to understand specific needs or requirements to apply skills/knowledge.

Qualified candidates must be authorized to work in the United States. The American Red Cross does not sponsor employment visas.


Experience with DevOps Tools like GIT, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, etc.
Demonstrated understanding of the architecture, capabilities and constraints of Salesforce applications required.

+++++++++++++++++




















The American Red Cross is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Interested in Volunteering?

Life's emergencies don't stop, and neither do American Red Cross volunteers, who represent more than 90 percent of our workforce to help prevent and alleviate human suffering. You can make a difference by volunteering in a position that appeals to you and allows you to use your unique skills and talents. The Red Cross relies on generous volunteers who give their time and talent to help fulfill our lifesaving mission.

Visit redcross.org/volunteertoday to learn more, including our most-needed volunteer positions.

Title: Salesforce Developer
Job_Description:
Job#: 1297492

Job Description:
Our great client in Milwaukee, WI has an immediate contract to hire opening for a Remote Senior Salesforce Developer role. If you are interested please apply with resume to aboettcher@apexsystems.com.

As a Senior Salesforce Developer and Administrator, you will be a part of the growing CRM Delivery team, building technical solutions on the Salesforce platform to support our Sales and Marketing business strategies. You will play a critical role in analyzing complex business problems and implementing solutions that will support and enhance the functionality of our growing business applications infrastructure.

You will be responsible for the design, development, testing and implementation of customizations, applications, extensions and integrations. You will need to demonstrate an understanding of software engineering concepts and be responsible for working on full lifecycle engineering efforts using Agile methodologies, object-oriented design, and accepted design patterns and practices. Additional responsibilities include:

Identify and gather requirements, translating into scalable solutions to address company-wide issues and make processes more efficient while adhering to Salesforce best practices
Develop and maintain APEX code, technical documentation, and test classes for all custom development
Understanding of Salesforce APIs used to integrate with other systems in the organization
Manage all aspects of Salesforce suite of products including Sales Cloud, Salesforce Maps, HVS, Tableau CRM and Inbox
Review and understand new Salesforce product and technical capabilities resulting from product releases and acquisitions; implement as needed
Management of third-party applications including OwnBackup, InGenius, and Sales Cloud
All aspects of user and license management including new user setup, roles, profiles, permissions, public groups, OWD, sharing rules
Salesforce configuration changes, including Workflow, Process Builder, Flow, assignment rules, approval processes, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, mobile administration
Data management to improve Salesforce data quality, implementing rules and automation as needed
Conduct data loads to Salesforce and data extracts using Salesforce Data Loader
System maintenance including Security Reviews, Release Updates, Health Checks, and Optimizer
Create reports and dashboards
Acts as a leader and regularly coaches others in area of expertise
Do you have what it takes?

Strong Salesforce product knowledge of Sales Cloud, Salesforce Maps and Tableau CRM with 5+ years administrative and development experience
Development experience with Lightning Web Components, APEX Classes/Triggers, Visualforce
Development experience with REST services, JavaScript, XML, CSS, HTML, SQL
Working knowledge of Source Control Management tools (GIT)
Strong business acumen with proven ability to design and optimize business processes and to integrate business processes across disparate systems
Strong knowledge of Object-Oriented analysis and design
Strong knowledge working with relational databases including design, management, transformation, and migration
Basic knowledge of Azure Active Directory, SAML, and OAUTH
Experience with Marketo application a strong plus


Thrive in a collaborative environment
Listen to others and help solve their problems
Be creative and think outside of the box
Work and communicate with others, both technical and non technical
Work in a fast-paced environment and manage priorities judiciously
Have excellent organizational, verbal and written communication skills
Exhibit superior analytical and problem-solving abilities


Mortgage Industry knowledge and terminology
Cloud-based technologies

We are a B2B2C software company. FormAssembly’s mission is to help organizations collect, use, and be good stewards of the personal data entrusted to them by their customers. We aim to help businesses streamline their processes by providing best-in-class form building, data processing, workflow automation and third-party integrations. Data Stewardship is about helping our customers be responsible consumers of personal data in a world that is increasingly concerned about data privacy, data breaches, and the lack of transparency over the use of personal information. Our Data Collection platform is ideally positioned to help our customers step up their data governance practices and comply with their legal obligations.
FormAssembly is growing and we are excited to add a Product (UX) Designer to help provide exceptional user experiences and scale our product portfolios for the next phase of our growth. This position is a key part of our Product team and is an important and strategic role in the Product Life Cycle.

Title: Senior Product Manager
Job_Description:
Digital UX Designer: Become the Newest Member of our Client!
This new role will support frontend web design initiatives on the Client’s digital platform. The ideal candidate will be current on emerging user interface trends, particularly those that influence how users navigate websites and find and buy products. As a member of the Digital Commerce team, the Interactive Designer will work hand-in-hand with cross-regional digital commerce teams, internal digital design and brand marketing resources, digital commerce teams, DTC IT team, and external design and development resources. This person will collaborate with DTC IT teams to build site standards, recommend platform javascript libraries, and implement custom client-side javascript as necessary. Title: Senior Product Manager
Job_Description:
Healthcare’s helping hand.

CHG shook things up in 1979 by inventing the locum tenens staffing model. We connect doctors with patients who need their care. As the largest physician staffing firm in America, our providers treat millions of patients each year.

Our industry is growing and demand is high. This means you’ll have plenty of opportunities to grow and develop in your career. Keeping healthcare healthy can be as fun as it is rewarding.
CHG puts people first, so we’re looking for a Product Manager to join our Digital team to work on exciting new products that improve our employee’s lives. You’ll lead the discovery and implementation phases of complex projects, own feature delivery roadmap, create user stories for feature epics, work closely with engineering to deliver solutions, and continuously improve our feature set to ensure we’re giving our customers the best experience in the industry.
You’ll be responsible for owning discovery of complex products in a matrixed organization, so you’ll need the collaboration skills to manage a lot of moving parts among many different roles without command-and-control authority. We’re looking for a servant-leader that’s comfortable getting in the weeds with engineers and our business to drive the feature roadmap to fruition. This position reports to the Director of Product Management on the Product Management Team.





We are an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer
Veterans/Disabled
We are an at-will employer

Title: Senior Product Manager
Job_Description:
User Experience (UX) Designers will find an opening with one of Robert Half's clients. This User Experience (UX) Designer job is for someone who can conceive and conduct user research, interviews and surveys, and translate them into sitemaps, wireframes and prototypes. In this role, you will also design the overall functionality of the product and iterate upon it to ensure a great user experience. This job is looking for a person who can prove they are a creative thinker who enjoys working independently as well as collaborating with colleagues. This permanent employment opportunity is based in the Duluth, Georgia area.

Your responsibilities

Focus areas may consist of content, controls, visual design, packaging, customer/technical support, branding, and other aspects of user experience
Produce satisfying experiences for users of a product, based on results from user research and workflow analysis
Work with Product Owners and Business Stakeholders to understand their strategic objectives and be responsible for ensuring our UX creative excellence
Be involved in translating business goals into designs and high-fidelity prototypes that can be used to test and validate with users through design sprints
Produce and present readiness documents to development teams and stakeholders to ensure design is implemented consistent with intent
Measure adoption and derive actionable insights to continuously improve experiences
Act as a strategic liaison between the the client's and the supporting third parties, evaluating work and sharing feedback
Help internal stakeholders and external partners uphold quality, consistency and alignment across all initiatives
Act as a UX Creative design and brand identity resource for the client
Initiate programs that create innovation and inspire the client on the effective use and potential of our CX/UX capabilities
Communicate ideas and sell concepts, with an aptitude for negotiation
Demonstrate strong social skills and the ability to influence others without coercion, using relationship-based, emotionally intelligent persuasion. A deep respect for collaboration and partnership is a must
Help create best practices and processes
Field research experience and strong understanding of usability testing a plus
5+ years of experience with Digital applications
Excellent skills in UX design, interaction design, and visual design showcased in a portfolio
Proficient in Adobe Create Suite, Sketch, XD, Axure or similar software
Experience working with a Design System; Manage the digital creation and evolution of guidelines, frameworks, and systems that help us more effectively manage our UX practice
Knowledge designing for Salesforce or Pega systems is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills
Creation of strong visuals to help create narrative and help facilitate understanding of design concepts along with experience in workshop facilitation is a plus

Please connect with Alex Parton on LinkedIn if you are interested in the role.

Title: Senior Product Manager
Job_Description:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

Title: Senior Product Manager
Job_Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Our Company
Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity
Marketo’s Sales Apps team is looking for an enthusiastic and skilled developer to help build performant software that directly impacts the day to day lives of our end users. We've got a platform that is used by thousands of salespeople and sales teams and that is tightly integrated with the world’s #1 Marketing Engagement Platform. We have integrations into Gmail, Outlook, Salesforce & many others to provide seamless customer experiences.
As a full-stack developer, you’ll be an integral member of our Engineering team and have a strong technical background, participating in architecture discussions, technology reviews, mentor fellow engineers, and participate in pull requests. You’ll provide valuable feedback on the product user experience and help drive a superior product to a wide audience and work on impactful, complex problems that requires a broad range of technical skills.
What you'll Do
Design, build and maintain efficient, reusable components that align with internal architecture standards
Focus on quality, automation and performance benchmarking to deliver high quality and reliable code
Work with product managers, UX designers and peers to turn requirements into features with focus on streamlined user experience
Work with QE team to come up with test cases and ensure the highest quality of features being released
Participate in architecture reviews, code reviews and collaborate with peers to identify tools to enable our CI/CD pipeline running smoothly and keep our technology stack current
What you need to succeed
BS/MS degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Strong knowledge of CS fundamentals like Data structures, Algorithms and Object-oriented design
3+ years’ experience developing SaaS applications in similar roles
Experience with SQL and/or NoSQL databases such as MySQL, MongoDB, Redis etc.
Proven knowledge in developing, deploying, highly available, SaaS applications and services in public and private cloud
Knowledge of JavaScript functional & performance testing frameworks
Experience with agile development methodologies
Hands-on experience with Ruby on Rails, ReactJS a big plus
Positive work attitude, self-motivator, quick learner, and a team player

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.
If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.
Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

Title: Senior Product Manager
Job_Description:
Position Description:
Full Time: Full Time - Remote

Fenom Digital is a leader in digital transformation services. Our aim to revolutionize the world of Commerce Cloud and OMS with new integrations and solutions. We are expert strategic innovators, consultants, project managers, developers and technologists who partner with our clients to deliver high-impact eCommerce systems in a more efficient way.

Fenom Digitals culture is powered by strong team relationships, including a shared commitment to exceptional communication, performance and results. We call this RACING, and its an integral part of everything our people do. Additionally, Fenom Digital was recently named a Salesforce Commerce Cloud Partner of the Year for Best Up and Coming Partner 2022. The Salesforce Commerce Cloud Partner Awards recognize the outstanding performance of digital transformation commerce partners in the Salesforce ecosystem!

We are a REMOTE working team and this role can work anywhere in the USA! Our HQ is in Red Bank, NJ.


Fenom Digital is seeking a talented QA for a Full-time remote opportunity. In this role you will review and provide feedback on the work we provide for our clients. The environment is fast paced and the ability to switch between clients and projects quickly is a must.


Perform unit, UI/UX, defect, system and integration testing on Salesforce Commerce Cloud based sites.
Design, develop, document, and implement QA processes company wide.
Work closely with Project Managers, Business Analysts, Engineers, and Designers to ensure the highest level of quality product is delivered.
Create and document test cases and scripts for larger projects including end-to-end eCommerce site launches.
Perform additional testing as needed with other vendor applications and other Salesforce Clouds.
Contribute to an ongoing process of improving test efficiency and accuracy by influencing process, tool, and infrastructure improvements
Participate in team meetings, working with developers, business analysts, project managers, user advocates, and other testers.


Minimum of 4 years experience with QA
Minimum of 2 + years of experience specific to Salesforce Commerce Cloud
Firm grasp of Salesforce Commerce Cloud features and extensions
Ability to switch between clients and projects quickly
Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills
Ability to work under minimal supervision with a team or on your own
Able to think critically and adapt quickly within a dynamic environment
Experience doing QA testing in SFCC (formerly Demandware) environments including familiarity with Business Manager
Strong knowledge of the software development lifecycle, roles, and work in an agile environment is a plus
Familiarity with the Atlassian Suite (JIRA, Confluence) or other defect tracking systems


Remote work flexibility
Unlimited PTO
401(K) with employer match
Competitive compensation and benefits (including a health insurance option fully free of charge to the employee in addition to other health insurance options for medical, dental, vision)
Life Insurance
Parental leave and family friendly environment
Home office expense credit for new hires
In-person and virtual events (think happy hour, coffee chats, afternoon stretch break, game night, book & movie club, and more!)
Certification and learning opportunity

We are a global organization committed to an inclusive work environment where employees can bring their authentic self to work each day. As an equal opportunity employer, we represent different nationalities, races, genders, ages, sexual orientations, and backgrounds connecting the Fenom Digital community. We hire top talent of diverse backgrounds, and we know that makes us stronger.

At Fenom Digital, we value Grit, Excellence, Transparency, Velocity, and Pride. Our values are our foundational core and central to our ongoing best practices, how we collaborate, and how we deliver.

Title: Senior Product Manager
Job_Description:
Seismic, a rapidly growing Forbes Cloud 100 company, is the global leader in enablement, helping make sales teams better by becoming more productive and engaging with buyers in a compelling way. Seismic's platform provides continuous guidance to improve behavior, content, and skills to win more deals and deliver better experiences. Nearly 2,000 organizations including IBM and American Express have made Seismic their enablement platform of choice. Seismic integrates with business-critical platforms including Microsoft, Salesforce, Google and Adobe. Seismic is headquartered in San Diego, with offices across North America, Europe, and Australia.
The Seismic Product Design team is a diverse group of fun, hard-working and highly collaborative people. Each designer brings a unique lens to table to help us realize our goal of designing software that is driven by empathy and validated with data.

Seismic continues to expand our product design team, and we're looking for a passionate and talented Product Designer to help us design and build the next generation of Seismic products. You will create beautiful and inspiring user experiences that help users create, discover, and interact with sales content managed in the Seismic platform. You are an excellent communicator, self-starter, and collaborative enthusiast.

#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Do you love complex problems, helping people find exactly the right product solution, and making it seem simple? Crowdstrike is looking for you! The new design team will partner creatively and strategically with a cross-functional team of product managers, marketers, engineers, analysts, and designers to help build and improve the experience for our internal user and customers throughout the sales and support processes.
CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. For applicants in Ithaca - NY, New Jersey City - NJ, and Colorado, the salary range is $145,000 - $230,000 per year + bonus + equity + benefits. A candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, and certifications. The salary range may differ in other states.

Title: Sr. Informatica/MDM Developer
Job_Description:
Job#: 1310464

Job Description:
Responsibilities:
You will be playing a pivotal role in shaping our Salesforce Platform capabilities, work with various business and technology stakeholders and be part of the Salesforce center of excellence
You will be partnering with the product owner, product analysts and the Salesforce engineering team to identify the appropriate Functional and Regression test cases for the user stories in the Salesforce platform backlog
You will be responsible in Creating the test data for developer/analyst using automation scripts and assist Developer/Analyst and product owners in Test execution activities.
You will be responsible for test cases, test scripts, test plan, end to end test scenarios and assist in defining the acceptance criteria for the requirements
You will work alongside a great team of Salesforce engineers, scrum masters and data engineers who constantly strive towards developing each other and driving the organization's aspirations ahead
Participate in the product increment planning and document test plan and test scenarios in collaboration with the product owner, product analysts and engineers
Assist Test Leads/Peers in creating the overall test plan and strategy for the CRM initiatives and product rollouts
Break down the complexity of the test scenarios into unit, system, and user acceptance categories
Clearly document the test scenarios for all user stories in the product backlog
Perform validation of Platform customization through the sprints – Integration and User environment
Own the system integration testing and move the user stories ahead into user acceptance testing
Ensure business stakeholders are completing the user acceptance testing and obtain approval to release to production
Coordinate and Assist UAT teams in validating the product enhancement meets the intended requirements
Ensure that the Salesforce platform backlog is comprehensive with sized user stories, enriched with testing estimates for developing automation scripts
Track all dependent team's testing and ensure smooth sprint completion
Follow up with all engineers to ensure the stories are moved through the SIT, UAT environments in time to keep the sprint effective
Assist in coordinating the go-live Quality Assurance activities including the test execution of the production specific test plans and checklists
Assist in ensuring that the sprint goals are met each sprint
Own any production defects validation, test and funnel them through sprints towards fixes as applicable


10+ years of experience in software testing and quality assurance, which includes Functional, Automation, Regression, System, Integration, Validation, UAT Coordination and End to End testing on Web based Applications
5+ Years of experience in customer relationship management application testing, and experience in testing applications/platforms hosted on a Cloud services
Experience in testing web services, UI and Mobile Responsive and native app testing
Experience in using Azure DevOps – Test plan module and develop test plan, test procedures, test completion report, test metrics, test scripts, test cases and root cause analysis
Extensive experience with Regression testing including writing regression test scenarios and execution
Must have knowledge of Salesforce Software QA methodologies, tools, procedures, and testing techniques
Experience in Developing test automation scripts using Selenium based Keyword/data drive frameworks
Experience in test data management tools for data retrieval from SQL/TDM tools
Required Ability to Independently drive projects and outcomes, work with minimal supervision. Strong problem solving, critical thinking, organization, and communication skills. Must be flexible to learn / adapt new coding language as required. Develop new utilities to support test automation needs
Team player who can work with different teams in the organization in a seamless manner
Well versed in test case management using ADO and Confluence
Development experience will be a huge plus

If interested, please send a Word format updated copy of your resume to Jennifer, jherder@apexsystems.com

Healthcare Without Rival
Premise Health is the world's leading direct healthcare provider and one of the largest digital providers in the country, serving over 11 million eligible lives across more than 2,500 of the largest commercial and municipal employers in the U.S. Premise partners with its clients to offer fully connected care – in-person and in the digital environment. It operates more than 800 onsite and nearsite wellness centers in 45 states and Guam, delivering care through the Digital Wellness Center and onsite, nearsite, mobile, and event solutions.

Premise delivers value by simplifying complexity and breaking down barriers to give diverse member populations access to convenient, integrated, high-quality care. We offer more than 30 products, delivering the breadth and depth of care required to serve organizations' total populations. The result is healthcare that meets the needs of members and their families, helping them live healthier while lowering costs for organizations.

Premise offers a wide range of dynamic, purpose-driven career opportunities. We are currently looking for a to join our team remotely.

The Salesforce Developer will be part of the team that is responsible for the support of business applications that fall outside of the Finance & Accounting and HR/Payroll areas. Responsibilities will include serving as the Salesforce Developer including day to day maintenance, enhancements, and some end user support.







Work-life balance is at the foundation of how decisions are made and where Premise is headed. We can only help people get, stay, and be well if we do the same for ourselves. In addition to competitive pay, Premise offers benefits packages including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), paid holidays and vacation time, a company-sponsored wellness program, and much more our talent acquisition team will be happy to share with you.

Premise Health is an equal opportunity employer; we value inclusion, and we do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.

Compensation is between $80,000 to $95,000 annually. Premise offers a comprehensive benefits package to all full-time team members including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays, annual CEU/CME allowance, and Tuition Reimbursement. Benefits offered to part-time team members include 401K, Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays and annual CEU/CME allowance. PRN team members may also enroll in 401K.

To support Premise Health’s commitment to the safety, health and wellbeing of our team members, clients and patients, Premise Health encourages all new team members to be fully vaccinated and up to date with a COVID-19 vaccine. Graco manufactures and markets premium equipment to move, measure, control, dispense and spray a wide variety of fluid and powder materials. What does that mean? Well, we pump peanut butter into your jar, and the oil in your car. We glue the soles of your shoes, the glass in your windows and the screen on your phone. Help us build a beautiful and delightful cross-platform application that our users will love. Avochato is an enterprise mobile messaging company, based in San Francisco, that gives teams the tools needed to have lasting, ongoing, two-way messaging conversations with customers. Consumers today prefer to communicate with messaging applications, but enterprises are still built on email and phone systems. Avochato bridges this gap by upgrading teams to messaging. We believe real-time, two-way messaging provides the best customer experience while helping companies to scale efficiently. Avochato enables communication via text messaging, live chat, WhatsApp, and integrates with Salesforce Sales and Service Cloud.

Recently named a category leader and Top 50 Product on G2 Crowd for 2020, Avochato handles millions of messages per month across hundreds of happy customers. The company grew 15x in 15 months and raised a $5M Series A at the end of 2018.

Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. The ContiTech business area focuses on smart and sustainable solutions beyond rubber and develops digital and intelligent solutions in future-oriented sectors. Title: Systems Analyst
Job_Description:
ABOUT NEW SCHOOLS FOR BATON ROUGE
Founded in 2012, New Schools for Baton Rouge (NSBR) is a community partnership bringing together talent and resources to deliver excellent schools to students and families in Baton Rouge. Our mission is to ensure that there are high-quality educational opportunities available for every child in our city -- regardless of the zip code they live in. The Systems Analyst will support these efforts by empowering NSBR and its partners with easily-accessible data needed to make successful strategic decisions, ultimately enabling our organization to drive transformational impact in the education sector so that by 2030, no child in Baton Rouge has to attend a D or F-rated school ever again.
THE NEW SCHOOLS FOR BATON ROUGE TEAM
NSBR is an entrepreneurial organization of accomplished individuals who are both deeply rooted in their belief in educational equity and highly motivated to provide excellent schools for every child in Baton Rouge. NSBR provides critical thought leadership to the educational landscape, but it is best described as an “action-tank” – dedicating its resources to the implementation of ideas that lead to demonstrable results in favor of students. Understanding that this work is urgent and complex, team members are quick to identify opportunities that will further NSBR’s mission and exercise flexibility in reorienting their work. Team members think of themselves as jacks-of-all-trades and are eager to develop their expertise in topics that may be new to them but are mission-critical. Team members are valued not for what they already know but for their curiosity, innovation, drive, and what they can accomplish.

Title: Systems Analyst
Job_Description:
Purpose of Job We are seeking a talented Decision Science Analyst for either our San Antonio Home Office, Plano Campus, Phoenix Campus, Charlotte Campus, Colorado Springs Campus, Tampa Campus, or remote work environment available.

Provide decision support for business areas across the enterprise. Staff in this area will be responsible for applying mathematical and statistical techniques and/or innovative /quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make 'insight to action' recommendations to answer business objectives and drive change. The essence of work performed by the Decision Science Analyst involves gathering, manipulating and synthesizing data (e.g., attributes, transactions, behaviors, etc.), models and other relevant information to draw conclusions and make recommendations resulting in implementable strategies.

Job Requirements

About USAA

USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.


Identifies and manages existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and the job role.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled.
Follows written risk and compliance policies, standards, and procedures for business activities.
Leverages intermediate and some advanced business, analytical and technical knowledge to participate in discussions with cross functional teams to understand and collaborate on business objectives and influence solution strategies.
Applies advanced analytical techniques to solve business problems that are typically medium to large scale with impact to current and/or future business strategy.
Applies innovative and scientific/quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make 'insight to action' recommendations to answer the business objective and drive the appropriate change.
Translates recommendation into communication materials to effectively present to colleagues for peer review and mid to upper-level management.
Incorporates visualization techniques to support the relevant points of the analysis and ease the understanding for less technical audiences.
Identifies and gathers the relevant and quality data sources required to fully answer and address the problem for the recommended strategy through testing or exploratory data analysis (EDA).
Integrates/transforms disparate data sources and determines the appropriate data hygiene techniques to apply.
Thoroughly documents assumptions, methodology, validation and testing to facilitate peer reviews and compliance requirements.
Understands and adopts emerging technology that can affect the application of scientific methodologies and/or quantitative analytical approaches to problem resolutions.
Delivers analysis/findings in a manner that conveys understanding, influences mid to upper-level management, garners support for recommendations, drives business decisions, and influences business strategy.

When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not be able to change your responses.


Bachelor's degree in quantitative analytics field such as Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Operations Research, Data and/or Business Analysis, Data Science or other quantitative discipline; OR 4 years of related experience in statistics, mathematics or quantitative analytics (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.
4 years of experience in data/analytics or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance)
OR
Advanced degree in quantitative analytics field such as Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Operations Research, Data and/or Business Analysis, Data Science or other quantitative discipline with 2 years experience in data/analytics or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance).
Demonstrates competency in mathematical and statistical techniques and approaches used to drive fact-based decision-making.
Intermediate and some advanced knowledge of data analysis tools, data visualization, developing analysis queries and procedures in SQL, SAS, BI tools or other analysis software, and relevant industry data & methods and ability to connect external insights to business problems.


2+ years hands on development experience with Python in a professional setting for process automation and advanced analytical capabilities.
2+ years hands on development experience with Tableau.
2+ years hands on development experience and expert knowledge working with a variety of data platforms (Snowflake, Salesforce, Hadoop, Oracle) and tools / techniques (API, Virtualization) to extract and synthesize data into meaningful and actionable insights.
Basic understanding of best practices and concepts for Data Management (Data Quality, Data Governance, Data Modeling, Data Architecture).

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.


USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market position. The salary range for this position is: $72,900 - $131,400 * .

Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance or at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.

will be addressed on an individual-basis for applicable roles that are consistently scheduled for non-core hours.


At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. Title: Systems Analyst
Job_Description:
Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.
Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future. Too often it's because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium-sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.
RevOps is at the core of the five major verticals of the business: Marketing, Sales, Partnerships, Onboarding & Customer Success. We are working with stakeholders to build an internal infrastructure to scale while also providing actionable insights to managers for workforce optimization.
We are a rapidly growing company and it's essential that all teams are delivering maximum outputs.

The person in this role will be instrumental in identifying and communicating key trends and areas for improvement on an individual and regional basis to drive this productivity.

Title: Systems Analyst
Job_Description:
Business Analyst, Financial ServicesJob Description
Gerent is on the lookout for talented Salesforce Business Analysts with experience in theFinancial Services industry.You will be part of a team responsible for delivering enterprise cloud technology solutions to delight our clients and improve their quality of life at work.
The Financial Services vertical is an area of growth for Gerent, where we are seeking people knowledgeable in the various sub verticals in the space such as retail & commercial banking, lending & mortgages, capital markets, insurance, venture capital/private equity, and wealth management. The successful candidate will have a working knowledge of one or more of these spaces, as much of their responsibility will be focused on these areas.
Our Salesforce Business Analysts are responsible for supporting requirements gathering, business process mapping, QA testing and end user testing. They may also be required to complete some basic Salesforce configuration and post deployment support. As a SalesforceBusiness Analyst, you will work alongside Solution Architects, Technical Architects andIntegration Architects as the Client Champion to advocate for solution elements that meet and exceed the clients expectations and underlying skills. You are a valuable asset to the team throughout the process of design, development, and deployment of large-scale enterprise solutions all while learning and growing your skill set.

Title: Systems Analyst
Job_Description:
Company Overview:
ADT has been in the business of helping save lives since 1874. As the #1 smart home security provider in the U.S., we help protect and connect families, businesses and larger commercial customer every day. Our continuous innovation, advanced technology and strategic partnerships deliver products and services that help protect life and valuables, whether at home, your business or on the go. And as times change, so do we. Above all, our mission is clear: we help save lives for a living. Looking for a career where you can make a real impact? Join our team today and put purpose behind your paycheck. #WeAreADT
Check out more about life at ADT here.
At ADT, data and insights drive our growth, customer experience and customer retention initiatives. The Business Intelligence team provides business critical insights using data and analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and supports our internal business partners with the execution of company objectives and key results (OKRs).
As a Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence – Field Operations you will gain a deep understanding of our fast-changing business and use that understanding to drive measurable insights into the hands of key organizational stakeholders with the objective being improved customer, employee, and enterprise outcomes. In the role, you will have the opportunity to partner with internal data teams to provide data-driven insights to drive objectives related to customer effort, retention, and operational efficiency.

Title: Systems Analyst
Job_Description:
SALESFORCE ADMINISTRATOR
Accounting Seed is a rapidly growing accounting software company which sells a leading-edge application on the Salesforce.com platform. We are the fusion of two disciplines: Information Technology and Accounting.
We are in immediate need of a Salesforce Administrator. As a longtime Salesforce ISV partner, we embrace the Salesforce platform across our entire business, consequently as a Salesforce Administrator at Accounting Seed you’ll play a vital role. We are looking for a proactive individual that can help us continually optimize our Salesforce instance to allow us to focus on delighting our customers., You will be responsible for how our Salesforce instance operates across all departments from marketing to finance. Our team is all Salesforce fluent so you should enjoy managing multiple priorities from a passionate user base. We are looking for someone with a deep understanding of the Salesforce platform, who can understand both our current setup and our business objectives, in order to quickly identify areas of improvement. The Salesforce Administrator should be comfortable with change management and governance, as well as communicating, prioritizing and managing all aspects of a Salesforce project. The ideal candidate will be happy liaising with stakeholders at all levels, with the ability to translate technical information into layman’s terms, clearly explaining design options and their potential impact.

Title: Systems Analyst
Job_Description:
Holman is a global automotive leader that serves both commercial and consumer clients The Holman Way by always doing the right thing for our people, our customers, and the community since 1924. The Holman story began nearly a century ago as a single Ford dealership in New Jersey. Today, Holman, headquartered in Mount Laurel, New Jersey, is one of the largest family-owned automotive service organizations in North America with more than 6,500 employees across North America, the UK, and Germany.
Holman delivers a unique range of automotive-centric services including industry-leading fleet management and leasing; vehicle fabrication and upfitting; component manufacturing and productivity solutions; powertrain distribution and logistics services; commercial and personal insurance and risk management; and retail automotive sales as one of the largest privately owned dealership groups in the United States. Guided by its deeply rooted core values and principles, Holman is continuously Driving What’s Right.

Founded in 2004, SCN supports individuals and Jewish organizations through information and intelligence-sharing, security assessments of organizations and facilities, training, consultation, and incident response on behalf of hundreds of Federations, 50 partner organizations and over 300 independent communities as well as with other partners across sectors.

Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. Consult on the application of existing and new, approved technologies to develop solutions. Ensure the process of creation and delivery of design and solution in accordance with the architectural direction.

Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Customer Technical Services Analyst I
Customer Technical Services Analyst I

Overview

Transactis, a Mastercard company, works with banks and their merchants to transform traditional paper-based billing and payments to smarter electronic transactions that are more efficient, cost-effective and environmentally friendly. Since 2007, Transactis has been a leading provider of Electronic Bill Presentment and Payment (EBPP) solutions to businesses of all sizes.

As the Customer Technical Services Analyst I you will be responsible for providing first line customer support to all our clients via phone and e-mail, troubleshoot issues, handle informational requests and deliver well designed and documented solutions to our customers in a timely manner. Our clients contact us for assistance with various topics such as utilization of new or existing system functionality, resolution of system bugs or performance issues reported by end users, requests for changes to the platform, and assistance with customer communication. In this role, we will rely on you to be knowledgeable about our complete solution and provide resolution, consultation and education to users that represent the best practices for utilizing the EBPP platform. We expect our Technical Services Analysts to pursue the highest levels of customer satisfaction and create the experience that reflects our goal of being “easy to do business with.”

Cyber Intelligence Analyst
Rapid7 is looking for a Cyber Intelligence Analyst to join our “Threat Command” team and take our threat intelligence analysis capabilities to the next levels.
About the Team
As part of the Cyber Intelligence Analyst team, you will investigate trending global cyber events and emerging dark web threats, while using the IntSights platform and your own research skills to find pieces of information, connect the dots and establish timelines of attack, identify threat actors interests and motivations and track down the bad guys that pose a threat to our customers. You will gain a thorough understanding of the cyber threat landscape, from malware types and attack vectors to technical understanding of TTPs and their associated threat in order to replicate and mitigate them. This role will require excellent OSINT investigation abilities and familiarity with various dark web communities and ecosystems, coupled with advanced knowledge in cybersecurity fundamentals and underlying concepts..)

Title: Systems Analyst
Job_Description:
Company Introduction
9th Way Insignia is a service-disabled veteran-owned company bringing transformative technology to our government customers so they can achieve their missions. Our specialties include cybersecurity, cloud modernization, software development, data analytics, enterprise architecture, enterprise IT, analytics and artificial intelligence. Learn more about 9th Way Insignia at https://9thwayinsignia.com/

Team (Project) Introduction
9th Way Insignia is looking for a Jr. Information Security Analyst, to join the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Information Assurance Support Services (IASS) team to aid in the support of Assessment and Authorization (A&A) activities to include support in all aspects of the NIST Risk Management Framework (RMF) process.

The IASS project provides program management, administration, system security assessment, data automation, development, and process engineering services that support IA and its efforts to address SDLC visibility, ATO management, and continual process improvement in advance of system ATO expirations. Additionally, the IASS team will monitor and assist with IA process integration of all aspects of the VA cyber security A&A process, and applicable VA Quality, Performance, and Risk (QPR), VA Agile Center of Excellence (ACOE), VA Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA), and Product Line Management (PLM) processes. The scope is focused on improving and automating the SDLC and ATO processes for all stakeholders, not performing the individual stakeholder responsibilities.


The Jr. Information Security Analyst position aligns as an Engineer 1 level at 9th Way Insignia. As an Engineer, 1 your duties may include testing project components, identifying problems and discovering solutions, working on ongoing projects based on specifications or drawings, and collaborating with teams of other engineers. Typically performs multiple engineering-related tasks in various assignments within the project and firm. An Engineer, 1 has strong technical skills and background, a knack for learning new technologies, and a blend of good problem-solving and innovation needed to resolve a wide variety of technical production challenges.


The Jr. Information Security Analyst will provide VA Authorization Support by performing System Steward responsibilities in support of preparing and maintaining ATO packages and assisting system stakeholder teams, IA process improvement and development teams with testing, implementation and execution supporting automation processes completion of all Risk Management Framework (RMF) activities in the VA’s Governance, Risk and Compliance tool eMASS and further SDLC and Citizen of the Network support in VA Salesforce Ectropy module (as needed).


The salary range for this position is $61,677 – $77,096.23

*9th Way Insignia’s range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.



Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.


This position offers remote flexibility. 9th Way Insignia reserves the right to adjust work location based upon mission requirements.


All positions will require successful candidates to obtain and show proof of a COVID-19 vaccination (or medical/religious exemption) on the first day of employment. 9th Way Insignia is an equal opportunity employer and will provide reasonable accommodation to those individuals who cannot be vaccinated.


We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.hr@9th-way.com.

Title: Systems Analyst
Job_Description:
Great benefits. Competitive pay. We know these are some of the things people look for in a job.
But if you’re the kind of person who also cares about making an impact and serving our nation’s wounded warriors and their families, then you’re exactly the kind of person we’re looking for. When you join Wounded Warrior Project, you’re committing to making a difference. We make a commitment to you too – helping you to find that spark, ignite your passion to serve, and embark on a career with meaning and purpose.
At Wounded Warrior Project we recognize our mission cannot be accomplished without our talented teammates, which is why we’re proud to offer benefits such as:
A flexible hybrid work schedule (3 days in office, 2 days’ work from home)
Full medical, dental and vision coverage for both teammates AND family members
Competitive pay and performance incentives
The Wounded Warrior Project (WWP) Business Systems Analyst supports and maintains Information Technology (IT) solutions for WWP. The Business Systems Analyst gathers business requirements, creates and completes user acceptance testing, serves as liaison among IT and WWP business partners, providing technical and business solutions to meet user needs. The Business Systems Analyst translates business and functional requirements into technical specifications and works with team members to test and implement changes.

MVP collaborates with its customers to offer tailored production solutions to meter, mix, dispense, and apply materials. For over 80 years, MVP has been a leading equipment provider for the marine, infrastructure, pool and bath, oil & gas, transportation, aerospace, and wind industries.
As a family-owned business, MVP serves its customers and communities with integrity and respect to create a better experience. Our same core values with which the company was founded on 80 years ago continue to guide us today as we create a better experience for our employees, customers, and communities.

Duration: Direct Hire
Location: Remote
Description:
Please Note: Candidate must have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years and must be able to obtain Public Trust clearance.
Our Client is seeking a Sr. Salesforce Developer (Aura/LWC) to join their team 100% remotely to support the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) activities on the Marketplace Assister Technical Support (MATS) program. In 2018, they expanded MATS Salesforce to support CCIIO’s Marketplace Eligibility and Enrollment Group (MEEG); through the MEEG enrollment community, providing centralized issuer management workflows that enable CMS staff, issuers, and contractors to distribute targeted information and reduce manual work in disparate systems. They also provide centralized access to issuer information and plan data in MATS Salesforce in support of the annual qualified health plan (QHP) certification process led by the CCIIO Marketplace Plan Management Group (MPMG). In 2021, the MATS team began implementing an extended solution to facilitate substantial data collection and monitoring as CCIIO implements the Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2021. Through MATS Salesforce, our Client will support the registration and certification of Independent Dispute Resolution Entities (IDREs), provide a community where CMS staff and IDREs can manage the federal Independent Dispute Resolution (IDR) process, and maintain a system of record as the Federal Government receives complaints of violations of surprise billing protections by private health plans and issuers.

About the team

We provide a strategic partnership with our business partners by developing and processing compensation plans that are motivating and align with company goals in driving growth. We strive for accuracy and timeliness while also providing insightful analysis and data to the various groups we support.
About the role
This role requires an ambitious, proactive, and diligent candidate with a proven track record of building trusted relationships with key business partners. This person will thrive with change, relish solving new problems, and enjoy working in an innovative, fast-paced environment.
This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada and New York City the standard base pay range for this role is $87,800.00 - $140,200.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada and New York City and may not be applicable to other locations.

About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.
The Role

Title: Senior Salesforce Architect/Engineer
Job_Description:
The Challenge:
When a user tries a new system, they expect it to be intuitive and run smoothly. Functionality, reliability, and user experience are key to successful information systems–and that means rigorous testing. That’s why we need you, an aspiring quality assurance specialist who’s eager to help thoroughly test software and ensure that our team releases the best system possible.
As a Salesforce quality assurance specialist, you’ll work with analysts, testers, developers, and engineers on a team that evaluates developed systems to support the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). You’ll help develop and implement a test plan based on requirements, functional specifications, and design specifications. Using requirements analysis and software quality assurance, you’ll generate problem resolutions and track quality assurance standards to see how the system performs, then document the results and communicate system flaws to the development team so they can start improving the tool. You’ll build your experience in various types of testing, including manual, performance, accessibility, usability, user acceptance testing, and testing process improvement. This is an opportunity to broaden your skills in documenting and solving system deficiencies as well as leading and mentoring others and estimating testing efforts. Ready to make an impact by transforming and modernizing healthcare systems for our military Veterans? Work with us as we build systems to change Veterans Affairs for the better. This position is open to remote delivery anywhere within the U.S., to include the District of Columbia.

Title: Front End Developer/Technical Support Engineer
Job_Description:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) to drive end-to-end business intelligence solutions which integrate our data resources and catalyze commercial transformation. The candidate will be experienced in data modeling, building ETL pipelines, and developing dashboards which provide insights and enable business teams. The role will be cross-functional, and involve understanding workflows and data analytics requirements across commercial, finance, and IT organizations. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with strong technical skills and an eagerness to understand business needs/strategy.

Key responsibilities include:
Building data pipelines/models to combine relevant sources and generate the required granularity for reporting needs
Optimizing data warehousing processes and ETL performance
Designing business metrics to track performance drivers and provide benchmarking
Developing solutions to automate data validation and detect outliers in raw input
Creating dashboards and reports which provide insights (eg. through root cause attribution, trend analysis, leading indicators, etc.)
Integrating Voice of the Customer feedback and continuous improvement of dashboards


2+ years using PowerBI to build data flows and data models

2+ years of experience as an analyst or engineer in the data/BI space

Intermediate to Expert proficiency in SQL and DAX

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or quantitative field


Master’s Degree in Data Science, Statistics, or quantitative field
Familiarity with Google Analytics, CRM (Microsoft Dynamics, Salesforce), Google Ads, Microsoft Azure SQL Server and Google Big Query
Experience delivering data insights or performing analysis on large data sets

Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.

Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies.
